posts.post_content:
Staff+
  
[Bloom Tender](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloom Tender ) (With 5 colors on the field)
  
[Elvish Archdruid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Archdruid ) (With 4 other elves)
  
[Harabaz Druid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harabaz Druid ) (With 4 other Allies)
  
[Magus of the Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Coffers ) (With 7+ Swamps)
  
[Metalworker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Metalworker ) (With 3+ Artifacts)
  
[Priest of Titania](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Priest of Titania ) (With 4 other Elves)
  
[Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary ) (With 5+ forests)
  
[Viridian Joiner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viridian Joiner ) (With 5+ power)
  
[Wirewood Channeler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wirewood Channeler ) (With 4 other Elves)
  
   
All equal Infinite mana, and will win you the game.

Posted By: StuartHamilton (3/2/2010 7:41:33 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is likely the best "finisher" of any combo deck that gets infinate mana. There's TONS of ways of getting unlimited mana, from using Bloom Tender and Rofellos to an off the wall combo involving Channel, Lich's Mirror and Mirror of Fate. The best for any deck (since its colorless and uses 2 nice utility cards) is likely [Brighthearth Rings](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brighthearth Rings) and [Basalt Monolith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Basalt Monolith).
posts.html:

There's TONS of ways of getting unlimited mana, from using Bloom Tender and Rofellos to an off the wall combo involving Channel, Lich's Mirror and Mirror of Fate. The best for any deck (since its colorless and uses 2 nice utility cards) is likely Brighthearth Rings and Basalt Monolith.

posts.post_content:
One of the most tempting targets for [Myr Welder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Welder).  
  
Especially since then, the abilities can benefit from [Training Grounds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Grounds)!  
  
Or just imprint it alongside a [Khalni Gem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Khalni Gem), and go to town. What with your infinite life, tapping all your opponent's creatures, and drawing your deck, all while generating infinite mana.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
As long as you can tap for 5 mana with whichever creature you have all the mana you could want of whatever color that creature made, not to mention tapping any number of creatures, gaining as much life as you want, and drawing as many cards as you like from the staff itself.
  
Easily broken and deserves more than a 3.8 in my opinion.

posts.post_content: Don't forget [Axebane Guardian](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Axebane Guardian) with 4 other defenders. Not hard to achieve in a defenders-only deck. With the infinite mana combo and [Doorkeeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doorkeeper), you can force the opponent to discard its entire library in a single turn. Add [Rest in Peace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rest in Peace) for Reanimator decks and you are golden.

posts.post_content:
Once, when I had well over 5 elves out and few [Priest of Titania](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Priest of Titania)'s and [Elvish Archdruid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Archdruid)'s, my friend used a [Mindslaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindslaver) on me and then proceeded to mill me with my own Staff. What a turn of events.  
  
Moral of the story, the only player who the staff can directly kill by itself is yourself, interestingly.
